reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night as it was close to Heathrow. The cover on the bed was badly stained with cigerette burns in it. The carpet beside the bed was stained with ground in cigerette ash and the room smelled of smoke. We booked on line and couldn't find an option for non smoking room. The next morning there was no-one to be seen in the dining room for breakfast. We had asked for an early breakfast as we were taking someone to Heathrow the next morning and were told at reception that would be fine. In the end someone found us some cereal and the girl who came on to do reception made us some toast. Everything seems to be done as cheaply as possible in this hotel and we would definitely never stay there again.
reviews.title: Really bad

reviews.text: Absolute HOLE £69 for a double mattress 4 inch thick floor stained bathroom cracked windows are the cheapest ive seen anywhere and dont fit noisy dirty hole
reviews.title: Deserves no stars

reviews.text: AVOID it look good from the outside but dont be fooled i stay in hotels 3/4 days a week this is the worst ive stayed in apart from Toni and Marie's B&B in liverpool and that was a dosshouse for hookers and druggies
reviews.title: Its bad don't stay sleep in a skip its cleaner

reviews.text: But it was a close call
reviews.title: would I stay here again?

reviews.text: Food was awful I ordered the steak with cherry tomatoes and oinons at £13.95 and a pint of 1664 i couldn't see through the glass the beer was so cloudy
reviews.title: Depressing customer care

reviews.text: I personally found this to be a terrible hotel, really poor customer service and be prepared to be told anything over the phone to get the booking and then be told to take it or leave it when you get there.
reviews.title: A dodgy backroom type hotel

reviews.text: There were several skips dotted about the area, and what seemed to be abandoned building equipment. The owners seemed to live in a house in the back garden of what seemed to be a pretty poor victorian house, and there was a rundown bungalow in front of the hotel with a group of Bulgarian men living in it. TV's were very dodgy, with signals seemingly provided by a wires from 4 freeview boxes somewhere - which then gradually went into standby mode so that at the end of the evening there was only one channel which worked.
reviews.title: Levy's review

reviews.text: The pillows I had were so thin I may as well have used the towels to rest my head on and I couldn't sleep all night. On my second night I asked for two more pillows and was told that these were fine, no one else had complained - eventually I had someone grumpily drop two pillows off.
reviews.title: Cheap and slightly shabby

reviews.text: Shower was so poor that it felt like taking a shower under a dribble. Water temperature varied whenever someone elsewhere in the hotel turned a tap on or had a shower themselves - to the point where at one stage I had virtually no water coming out at all!!
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: Breakfast was served by two absent eastern Europeans who constantly misunderstood what was being said and took over an hour to be served!! When I said something to the manager (an Asian guy called Ruby who owned the place) he got angry and said it was my fault!! Pathetic customer service in my view and the sooner this place calls it a day the better in my opinion!! I'll be avoiding this place like the plague in future and telling everyone I know to do likewise!!
reviews.title: Not 4 Star with luxurious bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights and was disappointed in several aspects of the hotel. I found a dress ring just under my bed. Why wasn't it found during cleaning? Our hot breakfast was brought to the table before we had finished our cereals. Stains on the carpet, grouting on the bathroom floor was flawed which left dirty stains on the bath mat. The staff were friendly, just require better training.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.text: My sister and I booked a room at The Lawns next door to the Parkside on the internet a few weeks ago. On arrival there wasn't a twin bedded room available so we were taken by Alex to their sister hotel the Parkside International 1 minutes walk away. Reception lovely and clean and modern and the receptionist couldn't have been more polite and welcoming. The room we were shown to was of a good standard, modern, clean, quite large, equipped with kettle, hairdryer etc. Bathroom spotless and supplied with toiletries. White towels which seemed a bit thin but did a good job of drying! The view was over the car park but it didn't matter. The room was warm and despite being on a main road extremely quiet. The room was the quality of a Premier Inn. We didn't eat in the restaurant that evening but did greatly enjoy a freshly cooked full english breakfast the following morning again with excellent service from the staff. We only paid £60 for the room which I realise was a bargain but I cannot fault the hotel at all. It was only a 20 minute walk from Reading town centre, there's a Beefeater restaurant 2 minutes walk away and plenty of public transport on the main road. There was ample free and safe car parking and also free WIFI. I have no idea why this hotel has received bad comments from other travellers. I would certainly stay again and would recommend this hotel to other people.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel on outskirts of town

reviews.text: The room was clean, the staff were friendly, very efficient and helpful and the breakfast was good.
reviews.title: It's not so bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms need a little updating - old TV, stains on the carpet, a slight smell of previous smokers, and a shower that was difficult to control the temperature. However, these were niggles, rather than major problems.
reviews.title: Horrible room, horrible hotel and shocking prices!

reviews.text: Generally, what you pay for the room will give you a good guide to the standard you can expect. It's a 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: Bad Rooms, Bad Food, Bad Staff, Atmosphere even worse!

reviews.text: There are too many bad things about this hotel to list, but here are the highlights:
reviews.title: Horrid Place, Don't Go!

reviews.text: 1) Brown water came out of the shower.
reviews.title: Travelodge offers more

reviews.text: 2) My room smelled of smoke and was pretty dirty.
reviews.title: the one who came out of the dryer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) It took ages to check in & out as the staff were so 'relaxed' (i.e. lazy & rude).
reviews.title: Don't Do It

reviews.text: 4) The evening meal didn't really taste of anything and was ridiculously expensive.
reviews.title: Go because it's cheap and don't expect luxury
